description: W3C SCXML test verification status tracking. Tests marked as verified have passed validate-test-execution with LOW RISK assessment (Interpreter and AOT engines execute identically with correct W3C SCXML semantics).

144.notes: W3C SCXML 4.2: raise element inserts events at rear of internal queue (FIFO ordering)

147.notes: W3C SCXML 4.3: if/elseif/else conditional execution (first true clause only)

148.notes: W3C SCXML 4.3: else clause execution when if/elseif both false

149.notes: W3C SCXML 4.3: if/elseif/else - neither clause executes

150.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach declares new variable if item doesn't exist

151.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach variable declaration persistence

152.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach error handling - illegal array/item raises error.execution

153.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach iteration order correctness

155.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach executes content once per item

156.notes: W3C SCXML 4.6: foreach stops execution on child action error

158.notes: W3C SCXML 3.12.1: executable content executes in document order

159.notes: W3C SCXML 3.12.1: error causes subsequent elements to be skipped

172.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: send eventexpr evaluates datamodel at execution time

173.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: targetexpr evaluates current datamodel value at send execution time

174.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: typeexpr evaluates current datamodel value at send execution time

175.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: delayexpr evaluates current datamodel value at send execution time

176.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: param evaluates at send execution time with current datamodel values

178.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: param preserves duplicate keys with multiple values

179.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: content element evaluation and data preservation in send

183.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: If 'idlocation' is present, the SCXML Processor MUST generate an id when the parent send element is evaluated and store it in this location

185.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: send delay specification - delayed event dispatched after interval elapses

186.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: send param evaluation at send execution time (not dispatch time)

187.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: If the SCXML session terminates before the delay interval has elapsed, the SCXML Processor MUST discard the message without attempting to deliver it.

189.notes: W3C SCXML C.1: target='#_internal' adds event to internal queue (higher priority than external queue)

190.notes: W3C SCXML C.1: External queue via #_scxml_sessionid target - Validated with 1:1 log comparison

191.notes: W3C SCXML C.1: #_parent target sends events to parent session's external queue

192.notes: W3C SCXML C.1: #_<invokeid> target sends events to child session's external queue

193.notes: W3C SCXML C.1: SCXML Event I/O Processor without target routes events to external queue - Validated with 1:1 log comparison

194.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: If the value of the 'target' or 'targetexpr' attribute is not supported or invalid, the Processor MUST place the error error.execution on the internal event queue

198.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: Default send type is SCXMLEventProcessor when type/typeexpr not specified

199.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: If the SCXML Processor does not support the type that is specified, it MUST place the event error.execution on the internal event queue

200.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: SCXML Processors MUST support the type http://www.w3.org/TR/scxml/#SCXMLEventProcessor

201.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: Processors that support HTTP POST must use the value http://www.w3.org/TR/scxml/#BasicHTTPEventProcessor for the "type" attribute

205.notes: W3C SCXML 6.2: The sending SCXML Interpreter MUST not alter the content of the send - Validated with 1:1 log comparison

207.notes: W3C SCXML 6.3: cancel operation scoped to originating session, cannot affect child session's delayed events

208.notes: W3C SCXML 6.3: The Processor SHOULD make its best attempt to cancel all delayed events with the specified id.

210.notes: W3C SCXML 6.3: If the 'sendidexpr' attribute is present, the SCXML Processor MUST evaluate it when the parent cancel element is evaluated and treat the result as if it had been entered as the value of 'sendid'.

215.notes: W3C SCXML 6.4: typeexpr evaluates at invoke execution time with current datamodel value - Validated with 1:1 log comparison
